meanings.definition: A complete body of laws or legal principles
meanings.sent1: The pandects of the land ensure justice for all.
meanings.sent2: She studied the pandects of the constitution in law school.
meanings.sent3: The pandects of the library were so vast that she got lost in them.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a pandects of knowledge, containing every legal principle.
meanings.sent5: The pandects of ancient Rome were revered for their wisdom.

meanings.definition: A comprehensive collection or treatise on a particular subject
meanings.sent1: The pandects of recipes in her cookbook were her pride and joy.
meanings.sent2: He authored a pandects of gardening tips that became a bestseller.
meanings.sent3: The pandects of jokes he carried in his pocket always made people laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a pandects of fashion magazines, neatly stacked on shelves.
meanings.sent5: The pandects of knowledge in the encyclopedia amazed the students.
